title: Bank levy in California. Creditor emptied my account. Was money from school financial aide. Any special protections? exemptions?
question: I am on a very fixed income and this cleaned out my account. It was a bulk payment from school financial aide of about $2500; Any tips to get it back?
answers: I agree with Mr. Elie's response to your question. You should have received notice of the levy on your account. With exceptions, a written claim of exemptions must be filed with the levying officer within 10 days of the levy notice. I suggest you have an attorney review the facts surrounding the levy to see if there is anything that can be done. Good luck!

Unless the account was earmarked as a trust account, the ordinary rules are that they can vacuum clean your account.

However, you should've gotten papers instructing you to assert your exemptions. If not here are instructions and links to forms:

http://www.saclaw.org/uploads/files/Step-by-Step/SbS%20COE%20Bank%20Levy.pdf
